thread.title: 'Gold Rush' returns to Discovery Channel for sixth season of adventure
thread.title_full: 'Gold Rush' returns to Discovery Channel for sixth season of adventure | Examiner.com

author: Christine Nyholm
title: 'Gold Rush' returns to Discovery Channel for sixth season of adventure
text:
Play Sneak Peek: Gold Rush - Back to Mining Discovery Channel " Gold Rush " returns to Discovery Channel for its sixth season on Fri., Oct. 16, 2015 at 9 p.m. ET/PT., following its pre-show "The Dirt (8 p.m.). The series is Discovery Channel 's number one rated show. Attached is a sneak peek video of " Gold Rush: Back to Mining ."
Gold mining in the Klondike is a dangerous business. This season brings new challenges, adventures, equipment and power shifts. The drama unfolds in the treacherous Klondike, where men battle the elements, and each-other, to mine riches from the ground. This year there is said to be more gold than the miners have ever seen before.
Last year, Todd Hoffman and his crew were on the brink of bankruptcy, but now they are back with gold-rich ground. Todd's crew is blown away by staggering goals set for the season. Three generations of Hoffman men work on the claim and try to give Parker Schnabel a run for his money.
Young mine boss Parker Schnabel mined $3 million in gold last year but he drove his crew into the ground in the process. Parker will have to draw on everything Grandpa John taught him in order to avoid disaster this season by figuring out how to be an effective leader.
Legendary Klondike mining boss Tony Beets ("The Viking") is resurrecting his 75 year old mining dredge but he needs to actually produce gold. Naysayers think he is crazy to mine the old-fashioned way and Tony wants to shut them up and prove the old-timers had it right.
"Gold Rush" is produced for Discovery Channel by Raw Television.
